result.title: Report and Open Access paper on UCs and farm level performance
result.description: This assessment will consider farm performance at two levels: (i) at the individual crop level, and (ii) at the level of a farm as a whole. Open access publication will be produced, making the data publicly available.

result.title: Fully loaded Agrobiodiversity data warehouse platform
result.description: A platform will be constructed based on the mapping of the value chain actors, identification and integration of the data retrieved from their operations, selection of the kind of data that is relevant for the value chain assessment and modelling and understand how to retrieve data automatically on the long term.

result.title: Fully mapped value chain actors for UCs and AURORA Farms
result.description: Value chains are complex systems which are constantly changing especially under conditions affected by unexpected eg pandemic situations This deliverable will deliver the mapping and analysis of how DVCs for UCs are managed across Europe using our AURORA Farms as case studies

result.title: Inventory of collections multiplied, made available to partners
result.description: Identification, collection and multiplication of the genetic resources of RADIANT core UCs. Individual owners of the germplasm will do their own multiplication. Related data will be reported, including the putative geographical origin of the accessions. Efforts will be made to gather historic phenotypical data (literature-based), to enhance and complement the project generated data. Information will be gatherd on and, where research work is proposed, arranged to multiply the working collections.

result.title: European UC-Cluster
result.description: Coordinators of the other SFS-01-c projects will be engaged from the project onset. A dedicated European UC-Cluster will be created, coordinated by UCP and co-led by the Coordinators of the other SFS-01-c projects. The foundation for the UC-Cluster will be established within the first year of RADIANT and the network will work as a functional group of stakeholders realising producer-consumer linkages via DVC.

result.title: A framework for the analysis of current policy and governance of agrifood systems
result.description: We will review the main components of the European policy environment that has the potential to increase agricultural biodiversity We will identify policy windows in the broader policy framework cultivar and novel food registration nutrition trade procurement climate through studies looking at the impact of these policies on decisionmaking and will involve experts and stakeholders from selected case studies to assess the role of EU policy and implementation

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as Digital transition).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europes financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europes financial contribution to Europes biodiversitys path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
